Comment: This ruling is a banger. Instant classic, hall of fame.  Where's the MAGA "muh constitution" supporters?  > No American President has ever before issued executive orders like the one at issue in this lawsuit targeting a prominent law firm with adverse actions to be executed by all Executive branch agencies but, in purpose and effect, this action draws from a playbook as old as Shakespeare, who penned the phrase: “The first thing we do, let’s kill all the lawyers.” When Shakespeare’s character, a rebel leader intent on becoming king hears this suggestion, he promptly incorporates this tactic as part of his plan to assume power, leading in the same scene to the rebel leader demanding “[a]way with him,” referring to an educated clerk, who “can make obligations and write court hand" Eliminating lawyers as the guardians of the rule of law removes a major impediment to the  path to more power. See Walters v. Nat’l Ass’n of Radiation Survivors, 473 U.S. 305, 371 n.24  (1985) (Stevens, J., dissenting) (explaining the import of the same Shakespearean statement to be “that disposing of lawyers is a step in the direction of a totalitarian form of government”).  > In a cringe-worthy twist on the theatrical phrase “Let’s kill all the lawyers,” EO 14230 takes the approach of “Let’s kill the lawyers I don’t like,” sending the clear message: lawyers must stick to the party line, or else.  > Using the powers of the federal government to target lawyers for their representation of clients and avowed progressive employment policies in an overt attempt to suppress and punish  certain viewpoints, however, is contrary to the Constitution  > Executive Order 14230 is unconstitutional

Comment: I just reread my comment and realized I went off on a tangent about the govt, as one does these days lol. The politicians are pure evil, for sure, but I feel the voters don’t get a pass on this one. 1st term, he showed us what he is: (insert favorite derogatory trump adjectives here). But to make the choice to get him in for a second time? Absolutely no passes given. We all saw the pandemic, Jan 6th, the entire 4 years between terms, the lack of respect and/or kindness to anyone not actively going along with his shit. We all knew this would happen, screamed it from the rooftops begging people to actually SEE what was coming.  Sure, you could chalk their choice up to dis/misinformation, lack of education, falling literacy rates, and all the “outs” I’ve seen people give the republican voters. But you can make a choice to learn, inform yourself, and broaden your horizons. And they didn’t. They just grunted “R good, D bad, Daddy Trump 4ever” and condemned us all to this shitstorm. There are people that can maybe forgive this (and good on you, you’re better than me), but I can’t. If we survive these 4 years, it will take generations to undo the damage. I thought we were making progress too, slowly but surely, and it’s being undone so quickly is disheartening. And exhausting, I’m so tired.  Also, to all the nonvoters who “couldn’t be bothered” or played the “both sides are bad” card: fuck you too, your inaction got us here just as much as the GOP voters action did. The choices of candidates may not have been the best, but a vote still should have been cast. So go sit at the Nazi table with the rest of the fuckheads.
